credential_data.description: The contents of the NATS 2.0 Credentials file to use

credentials.description: Path to the NATS 2.0 credentials file to use for authentication

servers.description: Comma separated list of NATS servers to connect to

ack_policy.description: The delivery acknowledgement policy to apply to the Consumer

ack_wait.description: Number of seconds to wait for acknowledgement

deliver_all.description: Starts at the first available message in the Stream

deliver_last.description: Starts at the latest available message in the Stream

deliver_new.description: Starts with the next available message in the Stream

delivery_subject.description: The subject where a Push-based consumer will deliver messages

durable_name.description: The durable name of the Consumer

filter_subject.description: Only receive a subset of messages from the Stream based on the subject they entered the Stream on

max_delivery.description: Maximum deliveries to attempt for each message

ratelimit.description: The rate limit for delivering messages to push consumers, expressed in bits per second

replay_policy.description: The rate at which messages will be replayed from the stream

sample_freq.description: The percentage of acknowledgements that will be sampled for observability purposes

start_time.description: The timestamp of the first message that will be delivered by this Consumer

stream_id.description: The name of the Stream that this consumer consumes

stream_sequence.description: The Stream Sequence that will be the first message delivered by this Consumer

ack.description: If the Stream should support confirming receiving messages via acknowledgements

duplicate_window.description: The size of the duplicate tracking windows, duration specified in seconds

max_age.description: The maximum oldest message that can be kept in the stream, duration specified in seconds

max_bytes.description: The maximum size of all messages that can be kept in the stream

max_consumers.description: Number of consumers this stream allows

max_msg_size.description: The maximum individual message size that the stream will accept

max_msgs.description: The maximum amount of messages that can be kept in the stream

replicas.description: How many replicas of the data to keep in a clustered environment

retention.description: The retention policy to apply over and above max_msgs, max_bytes and max_age

storage.description: The storage engine to use to back the stream

subjects.description: The list of subjects that will be consumed by the Stream

max_consumers.description: Number of consumers this stream allows

max_msg_size.description: The maximum individual message size that the stream will accept

max_msgs.description: The maximum amount of messages that can be kept in the stream

max_streams.description: Maximum number of Streams this Template can manage

name.description: The name of the Stream Template

replicas.description: How many replicas of the data to keep in a clustered environment

retention.description: The retention policy to apply over and above max_msgs, max_bytes and max_age

storage.description: The storage engine to use to back the stream
